summary: The Equal Access to Abortion Coverage in Health Insurance Act of 2025 (the EACH Act) aims to ensure affordable abortion coverage and care for all individuals, regardless of their income, insurance type, or other factors. The bill mandates coverage of abortion services in various federal health programs and plans, prohibits restrictions on private insurance coverage of abortions, and repeals specific provisions of the Affordable Care Act that impede abortion access. It also includes findings about the impact of abortion restrictions and a sense of Congress regarding the importance of abortion coverage.
